<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</B>
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D306372D10K_HTM_TX306372_1">
</A>
	PART I
</B>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D306372D10K_HTM_TX306372_2">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;1 &#150;
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Business
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	General
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	HCI Group, Inc. is
	a Florida-based company that, through its subsidiaries is engaged in a variety of business activities, including property and casualty insurance, reinsurance, real estate and information technology. Its principal business is property and casualty
	insurance. HCI was incorporated in 2006. References to &#147;we,&#148; &#147;our,&#148; &#147;us,&#148; &#147;the Company,&#148; or &#147;HCI&#148; in this Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	generally refer to HCI Group, Inc. and its
	subsidiaries. Our principal executive offices are located at 5300 West Cypress Street, Suite 100, Tampa, Florida 33607, and our telephone number is (813)
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	849-9500.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on our organizational structure, revenue sources, and evaluation of financial and operating performances by management, we manage four
	operating divisions under one reporting segment, which includes the following operations:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Insurance Operations
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Property and casualty insurance
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Reinsurance
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Other Operations
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Real estate
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	Information technology
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Insurance Operations
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Property and Casualty Insurance
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our principal operating subsidiary, Homeowners Choice Property&nbsp;&amp; Casualty Insurance Company, Inc. (&#147;HCPCI&#148;), was
	incorporated and began operations in 2007. Through HCPCI, we currently provide property and casualty insurance to homeowners, condominium owners and tenants on properties located in Florida. HCPCI&#146;s operations are supported by HCI and the
	following wholly owned subsidiaries of HCI:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Homeowners Choice Managers, Inc. &#150; acts as managing general agent and provides marketing, underwriting, claims settlement, accounting and financial services to HCPCI;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Southern Administration, Inc. &#150; provides policy administration services to HCPCI; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Claddaugh Casualty Insurance Company Ltd. &#150; provides reinsurance to HCPCI. (See
<I>
	Reinsurance
</I>
	below)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	HCPCI began operations by participating in a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	&#147;take-out
</FONT>
	program&#148; through which we assumed insurance policies held by Citizens Property Insurance Corporation (&#147;Citizens&#148;), a Florida state-supported insurer. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	take-out
</FONT>
	program is a legislatively mandated program designed to reduce the State&#146;s risk exposure by encouraging private companies to assume policies from Citizens. We have assumed policies in a series of
	separate transactions, which took place from July 2007 through November 2016. In addition, we acquired policies from one Florida carrier in November 2011. Substantially all of our premium revenue since inception has come from the policies acquired
	in these transactions and subsequent renewals. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, our premiums in force and policy count were approximately $375&nbsp;million and 150,000, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Policyholders whose policies have been assumed by us or another insurance company have the option to opt out of the assumption and return to
	Citizens. With respect to our November 2013 through November 2016 assumptions, the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	opt-out
</FONT>
	provision was limited to the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	thirty-day
</FONT>
	period preceding and following the
	assumption date. Policyholders who stay with us may cancel their policies any time. Citizens has historically required us to offer renewals on the policies we acquire in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	take-out
</FONT>
	program for a period of
	three years subsequent to their initial expiration. The policyholders have the option to renew with us or they may place their coverage with another insurance company. We strive to retain these policies by offering competitive rates and exceptional
	service to our policyholders. Opportunities to acquire large numbers of policies from Citizens meeting our strict underwriting criteria have diminished in recent years. We may, however, selectively pursue additional assumption transactions with
	Citizens as opportunities arise, provided the assumed policies meet our underwriting criteria. We also continually explore accretive opportunities to acquire business from other insurance companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	HCPCI began writing flood coverage for Florida homeowners in January 2014 in response to the demand for an alternative to the Federal National
	Flood Insurance Program for Florida homeowners. The flood coverage is offered on a limited basis as a policy endorsement to eligible Florida customers who are most likely to be impacted by the significant rate increases that may result from the
	Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform and Modernization Act of 2012. In October 2015, HCPCI was approved by the Florida Office of Insurance Regulation (&#147;FLOIR&#148;) to write standalone flood insurance policies for Florida homeowners. In
	addition, in 2016, we launched TypTap Insurance Company (&#147;TypTap&#148;), a Florida insurance subsidiary also approved by the FLOIR to write various insurance products for Florida homeowners. TypTap features an online platform for quoting and
	binding policies that is designed to be accessible by any Internet capable devices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We plan to seek opportunities to enter the property
	and casualty insurance market and establish our presence in other states, especially with residential flood insurance. We previously had one Alabama domiciled insurance subsidiary, Homeowners Choice Assurance Company, Inc., which had not written any
	insurance policies and has been dissolved and its license surrendered as of December 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our operating and growth strategies for
	our property and casualty insurance business are to continually optimize the existing book of business, manage our costs and expenses, diversify both geographically and with new product offerings, develop and deploy new technologies to streamline
	operations, including policy underwriting and production, and pursue accretive opportunities to acquire polices when they arise, whether from Citizens or other insurance companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We face various challenges to implementing our operating and growth strategies. Since we
	currently write policies that cover Florida homeowners, condominium owners, and tenants, we cover losses that may arise from, among other things, catastrophes, which could have a significant adverse effect on our business, results of operations, and
	financial condition. To mitigate our risk of such catastrophic losses, we cede a portion of our exposure to reinsurers under contracts called catastrophe excess of loss reinsurance treaties. Reinsurance is by far the largest cost to our property and
	casualty insurance business. Even without catastrophic events, we may incur losses and loss adjustment expenses that deviate substantially from our estimates and that may exceed our reserves, in which case our net income and capital would decrease.
	Our operating and growth strategies may also be impacted by regulation of our business by the State of Florida and other states in which we may operate. Currently we are licensed to operate in only Florida. To operate in any other state we must
	first obtain a license from the insurance regulatory authorities in that state. Insurance regulators also must approve our policy forms and premium rates as well as monitor our compliance with financial and regulatory requirements. Additionally, we
	may compete with large, well-established insurance companies, possessing greater financial resources, larger agency networks, and greater name recognition. See Item 1A, &#147;Risk Factors,&#148; below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Competition
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We operate in highly
	competitive markets where we face competition from national, regional and residual market insurance companies and, in the case of flood insurance, the U.S. government. We believe that we have approximately 10 significant competitors writing
	homeowners&#146; property and casualty insurance in the state of Florida. Based on September&nbsp;30, 2016 annualized premiums written data, from the FLOIR, excluding State Farm Florida Insurance Company, we are the fifth largest provider of
	homeowners&#146; property and casualty insurance in the state.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our competitors may have larger financial capacities, greater resource
	availability, and more diversification in terms of insurance coverage. Our competitors include companies which market their products through agents, as well as companies which sell insurance directly to their customers. In addition, large national
	insurers that left the Florida market more than a decade ago after numerous hurricanes impacted the state, may reenter the Florida homeowners&#146; property and casualty insurance market and they may have certain competitive advantages such as
	increased name recognition, increased loyalty of their customer base, and reduced policy acquisition costs. We may also face competition from new or temporary entrants in our niche markets. In some cases, such entrants may, because of inexperience,
	desire for new business, or other reasons, price their insurance products below ours. This pricing pressure may lead to overall premium reductions across the Florida market. We did in fact implement a rate decrease in January 2016 for our new and
	renewal homeowners multi-peril business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our competitive strategies focus on the following key areas:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Exceptional service
</U>
	&#150; We are committed to maintaining superior service to our policyholders and agents.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<U>
	Claims settlement practices
</U>

	&nbsp;

</TD>

<U>
	Disciplined underwriting
</U>
	&#150; We analyze exposures and utilize available underwriting data to ensure policies meet our selective criteria.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	New product offerings
</U>
	&#150; In addition to our flood-endorsed policies and wind-only program, we may cross-sell additional insurance products to our existing policyholders in order to broaden our lines of
	business and product mix or identify other lines of insurance to offer. Since the beginning of 2016, we have been offering flood-only policies to Florida customers.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	Effective and efficient use of technology
</U>
	&#150; We strive to add or improve technology that can effectively and efficiently enhance service to our policyholders and agents. For instance, we currently use our
	internally developed application,
<I>
	Exzeo
</I>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, to increase the efficiency of our claims processing and settlement. In addition, our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-line
</FONT>
	platform
	for quoting and binding residential flood policies streamlines the underwriting and policy production processes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<U>
	Geographical expansion
</U>
	&#150; We continue to seek opportunities to expand our business within the state of Florida and perhaps into other states to increase overall geographic diversification.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Price
</U>
	&#150; In the case of flood insurance, our rates are typically below the rates of the National Flood Insurance Program administered by the Federal Emergency Management Agency, which is the dominant provider
	of flood insurance in the United States.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Seasonality of Our Business
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our insurance business is seasonal as hurricanes and tropical storms affecting Florida typically occur during the period from June&nbsp;1
	through November&nbsp;30 each year. Moreover, with our reinsurance treaty years typically effective on June&nbsp;1 each year, any variation in the cost of our reinsurance, whether due to changes in reinsurance rates or changes in the total insured
	value of our policy base, will occur and be reflected in our financial results beginning June&nbsp;1 each year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Government Regulation
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are subject to the laws and regulations in any state in which we conduct our insurance business. The regulations cover all aspects of our
	business and are generally designed to protect
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>

</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	the interests of insurance policyholders as opposed to the interests of shareholders. Such regulations relate to a wide variety of financial and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-financial
</FONT>
	matters including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
</B>
	market conduct.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our failure to comply with certain provisions of applicable insurance
	laws and regulations could have a material, adverse effect on our business, results of operations or financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	Regulatory Uncertainty
</U>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain states including Florida have adopted laws or are considering proposed legislation which, among other things, limits the ability of
	insurance companies to effect rate increases or to cancel, reduce or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-renew
</FONT>
	insurance coverage with respect to existing policies. The Florida legislature continuously considers bills affecting the Florida
	residential property insurance market.&nbsp;Current law penalizes insurers for noncompliance with the insurance code, establishes a private cause of action relating to claims payment practices, extends the notice period applicable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-renewals
</FONT>
	of certain residential policies, prevents
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-renewals
</FONT>
	and cancellation except for material misrepresentation and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-payment
</FONT>
	of premium and establishes procedures governing rate filings. Any changes in such laws and regulations could have a material, adverse effect on our operations or our ability to expand.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	State Licensure and Approval
</U>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Most states, including Florida, require licensure and regulatory approval prior to the marketing of insurance products. Typically, licensure
	review is comprehensive and includes a review of a company&#146;s business plan, solvency, reinsurance, rates, and forms, the character of its officers and directors and other of its financial and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-financial
</FONT>
	aspects. The regulatory authorities may prevent entry into a new market by not granting a license. In addition, regulatory authorities may preclude or delay our entry into markets by disapproving
	or withholding approval of our product filings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	Statutory Reporting and Examination
</U>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All insurance companies must file quarterly and annual statements with certain regulatory agencies and are subject to regular and special
	examinations by those agencies. The National Association of Insurance Commissioners mandates that all insurance companies be examined
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	once every five years. However, the FLOIR has the authority to conduct an examination whenever it is deemed appropriate. HCPCI&#146;s latest financial examination completed by the FLOIR related
	to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. The FLOIR is currently conducting its financial examination related to the five years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Liability for Losses and Loss Adjustment Expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our liability for losses and loss adjustment expenses represents our estimate of the total cost of (i)&nbsp;claims that have been incurred, but
	not yet paid (case reserves), (ii) claims that have been incurred but not yet reported to us (&#147;IBNR&#148;), and (iii)&nbsp;loss adjustment expenses (&#147;LAE&#148;) which are intended to cover the ultimate cost of settling claims, including
	investigation and defense of lawsuits resulting from such claims. We base our estimates on various assumptions and actuarial data we believe to be reasonable under the circumstances. The process of estimating the liability is inherently subjective
	and is influenced by many variables such as past loss experience, current claim trends and the prevailing social, economic and legal environments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Significant time can elapse between the occurrence of an insured loss, the reporting of the loss to us and our payment of that loss. Our
	liability for losses and LAE, which we believe represents the best estimate at a given point in time based on facts, circumstances and historical trends then known, may necessarily be adjusted to reflect additional facts that become available during
	the loss settlement period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For a discussion and summary of the activity in the liability for losses and LAE for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, see Note 15 &#151; &#147;Losses and Loss Adjustment Expenses&#148; to our consolidated financial statements under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Loss Development
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our liability for losses and LAE represents estimated costs ultimately required to settle all claims for a given period. The following table
	illustrates development of the estimated liability for losses and LAE as of December&nbsp;31 for the years 2007 (inception) through 2016 (amounts in thousands):
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_3"></A>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Represents management&#146;s original estimated liability for (i)&nbsp;unpaid claims, (ii)&nbsp;IBNR, and (iii)&nbsp;loss adjustment expenses.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Represents the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-estimated
</FONT>
	liabilities in later years for unpaid claims, IBNR and loss adjustment expenses for each of the respective years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Represents the difference between the latest
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-estimate
</FONT>
	and the original estimate. A redundancy indicates the original estimate is higher than the current estimate whereas a
	deficiency indicates the original estimate is lower than the current estimate.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, revenues from insurance operations
	before intracompany elimination represented 95.5%, 97.5% and 97.2%, respectively, of total revenues of all operating segments. At December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, insurance operations&#146; total assets represented 87.9%, 91.8% and 94.1%,
	respectively, of the combined assets of all operating segments. There was no other operating division representing ten percent or more of our total revenues or combined assets. See Note 16 &#151; &#147;Segment Information&#148; to our consolidated
	financial statements under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Reinsurance
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have a Bermuda domiciled wholly owned reinsurance subsidiary, Claddaugh Casualty Insurance Company Ltd. We selectively retain risk in
	Claddaugh, displacing the need for HCPCI to pay premiums to third party reinsurers. Claddaugh fully collateralizes its exposure to HCPCI by depositing funds into a trust account. Claddaugh also from time to time mitigates a portion of its risk
	through retrocession contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Other Operations
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Real Estate
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our real estate
	operations consist of multiple properties we own and operate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Properties Used in Operations
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our real estate used in operations consists of our headquarters building in Tampa, Florida, and our secondary insurance operations site in
	Ocala, Florida. At our headquarters, we lease available space to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-affiliates
</FONT>
	at various terms. The Ocala location, in addition to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	day-to-day
</FONT>
</FONT>
	operational use, serves as our alternative site in the event we experience any significant disruption at our headquarters building.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Operations at Investment Properties
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our investment properties consist of a combined 24 acres of waterfront property, land and land improvements that include one full-service
	restaurant and two marinas as well as two recently acquired retail shopping centers. The combined marina facilities offer to the general public: a) one
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	dry-stack
</FONT>
	boat storage facility with capacity for
	approximately 314 boats; b) approximately 74 wet slips; c) two fuel facilities; and d) open areas for parking and storage.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Dry-stack
</FONT>
	boat storage space is generally rented on a monthly or annual basis while
	the wet slips are rented on a daily or monthly basis. We acquired the restaurant and marina operations in connection with our purchase of those properties and we continue to operate them to enhance the property values. We also lease available space
	to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-affiliates
</FONT>
	at one of these locations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	One retail shopping center with 61,400 square feet
	of net rentable space is located in Sorrento, Florida and is anchored by a large, well-known grocery retailer. It was formerly the subject of a real estate development and construction project in which we were involved through an acquisition,
	development and construction loan arrangement (&#147;ADC Arrangement&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the ADC Arrangement, Greenleaf Capital, one of our wholly owned subsidiaries, had an option to purchase the property when the construction project was completed contingent upon tenant
	rental commitments for at least 90% of rentable space being secured by the developer. On August&nbsp;16, 2016, we exercised the purchase option and acquired the property for a purchase price of $12,250,000, which resulted in a bargain purchase gain
	as of the acquisition date of approximately $2,071,000. See Note 6 &#151; &#147;Business Acquisitions&#148; to our consolidated financial statements under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Another retail shopping center with 49,995 square feet of net rentable space is located in Melbourne, Florida and also anchored by a large,
	well-known grocery retailer. In December 2016, we acquired full ownership of the property in which we had a 90%
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-controlling
</FONT>
	interest, resulting in a gain on remeasurement of approximately $4,005,000.
	Subsequent to the acquisition, we incurred an impairment loss of $388,000 due to the unexpected closure of one tenant&#146;s business. This property had been developed through a limited liability company described elsewhere in this report for U.S.
	GAAP purposes as a joint venture. See
<I>
	Investment in Unconsolidated Joint Venture
</I>
	in Note 4 &#151; &#147;Investments&#148; to our consolidated financial statements under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Ongoing Investment Project
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have one real estate development project described as a joint venture arrangement under U.S. GAAP, which we consolidate with our operations.
	We believe this type of cooperation with experienced real estate developers will enable us to grow our real estate portfolio and diversify our future sources of income. See Note 4 &#151; &#147;Investments&#148; to our consolidated financial
	statements under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K
</FONT>
	for additional information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Information
	Technology
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our information technology operations include a team of experienced software developers with extensive knowledge in
	designing and creating
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	web-based
</FONT>
	applications and products for mobile devices. The operations, which are located in Tampa, Florida and Noida, India, are focused on developing cloud-based, innovative products
	and services that support
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-house
</FONT>
	operations as well as our third party relationships with our agency partners and claim vendors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	Proplet
</U>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Proplet
</I>
	is an online platform for quoting homeowners policies for our subsidiary, HCPCI. This platform offers a map based solution for
	quoting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
<I>
	TypTap
</I>
</U>
<I>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	TypTap
</I>
	is an online platform for quoting and binding residential flood policies for our subsidiary, TypTap Insurance Company. This
	platform focuses on simplifying the user experience, which is entirely online. It is designed to be accessible from a mobile phone or any other internet capable device.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	SAMS
</U>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	SAMS
</I>
	is an online platform for supporting back-office policy and claims management for both of our insurance subsidiaries, HCPCI and
	TypTap Insurance Company.
<I>
	SAMS
</I>
	processes the full life cycle of a policy from policy quoting and issuance to agency management, cash receipts/disbursements, claims reserving and claim payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Some of the technologies originally developed
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-house
</FONT>
	for our own insurance operations have been
	launched for use by third parties. These technologies include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	Exzeo
</U>
</I>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Exzeo
</I>
	is a cloud-based application available at Exzeo.com which provides a
	highly customizable environment to support automation and process management to high volume environments. Exzeo.com specifically supports property claim assignments, logistics, and accountability reporting with our third party partners. Exzeo.com
	has rich system integration through an application program interface (API), which allows hands-free data transfer from any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	API-capable
</FONT>
	applications such as
<I>
	SAMS
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	Atlas Viewer
</U>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Atlas Viewer
</I>
	is our interactive cloud-based data mapping and visualization application. An industry agnostic product,
<I>
	Atlas
	Viewer
</I>
	allows users to combine data from multiple sources and leverage location coordinates to make more informed business decisions.
<I>
	Atlas Viewer
</I>
	allows system to system integration through an API or allows users to upload documents to
	view and securely share data on a customized map.
<I>
	Atlas Viewer
</I>
	is offered as a subscription-based service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<U>
	CasaClue
</U>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	TM
</SUP>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	CasaClue
</I>
	is a large database containing residential property data points
	important to underwriting residential flood insurance. TypTap, described above, utilizes
<I>
	CasaClue
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	11
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Environmental Matters
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our subsidiaries that own waterfront property, including marina facilities, are subject to regulations under various federal, state, and local
	laws concerning the environment, including laws addressing the discharge of pollutants into the air and water and the management and disposal of hazardous substances and wastes and the cleanup of contaminated sites.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Employees
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of
	February&nbsp;14, 2017, we employed 246 full-time individuals working primarily from our corporate offices in Florida and 76 employees located in India. In addition, our real estate operations have 77 employees leased through professional employer
	organizations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<U>
	Available Information
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We file annual, quarterly, and current reports with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;). These filings are accessible
	free of charge on our website,
<U>
	www.hcigroup.com
</U>
	(click &#147;SEC filings&#148; at the &#147;Investor Information&#148; tab), as soon as reasonably practicable after they have been electronically filed with or furnished to the SEC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	12
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D306372D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The SEC maintains an Internet site that contains reports, proxy and information statements, and other information regarding issuers, which can be accessed via the SEC&#146;s website at
<U>
	www.sec.gov
</U>
	. In addition, these filings are accessible at the SEC&#146;s Public Reference Room, which is located at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, DC 20549. Information on the operation of the Public Reference Room may be obtained by calling
	the SEC at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1-800-SEC-0330.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
